intro: Tiaridium monostachyum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetplant, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and stamens, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Tiaridium monostachyum is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain areas.
